body: Saurabh, I apologize for being late to the conversation.  I fixed the bug that Mostapha opened the issue for: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/commit/43c2587024a7e7a...](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/commit/43c2587024a7e7a739cdfc6d02eb32cf06a10480) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Wui*gYiAaOqnmf5qmmY2JDZO9lhSmAkdJcEi6KF9bgyc6tQBVQWGAXf*7avbdCfpQQiZXTmHL2cCrq6yQ13ztDIhpZPmRX6f/FixedCSVLighting.JPG) You can find a working file GH file attached.  However, to get rid of the component failure in your image, you are going to have to replace the 'OpenStudioMasterTemplate.idf' in your ladybug default folder with the one on the github here: [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/master/...](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/master/resources/OpenStudioMasterTemplate.idf) I apologize for this extra step but this implementation of CSV schedule capability on OpenStudio was really meant to be a rough hack until the OpenStuido team implements this capability on their own software and SDK in a year or so: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/161](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/161) -Chris
